symptoms.name: Redness
symptoms.pattern: Localized, initially affecting fingers and hands, may spread to other areas but usually not past the wrist

symptoms.name: Swelling
symptoms.pattern: Localized, affecting fingers and hands, may spread

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases, especially systemic infection

symptoms.name: Chills
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases, especially systemic infection

symptoms.name: Headache
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases, especially systemic infection

symptoms.name: Joint pain
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases, especially systemic infection

symptoms.name: Weight loss
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases, especially systemic infection

vital_signs.temperature: May be elevated (low-grade fever) in some cases
vital_signs.pulse: May be elevated in some cases

physical_findings: Redness and swelling of affected area
Wound with yellow-white suppurative discharge (in some cases)
risk_factors: Occupational exposure to animals (farmers, butchers, fishermen, veterinarians, cooks, etc.)
Contact with animal products (meat, fish, shellfish)
Presence of skin abrasions or cuts

required: Clinical presentation consistent with erysipeloid (localized skin lesions, redness, swelling, pain)
supportive: History of occupational exposure to animals or animal products
Elevated inflammatory markers (white blood cell count, C-reactive protein)
